author: raz
title: Impact Measurements Tool - research
description: Um desafio-chave para acompanhar o progresso do projeto + eficácia são as medições claras do impacto, especialmente para as Metas de Desenvolvimento Sustentável (ODS)

f6_assessments.q0: As medidas e definições -O QUE em alguma COISA - são a chave para qualquer processo de estabelecimento de metas e auditoria, e a AIM propõe levar essa especificidade de propósito aos proponentes que desejam quantificar e compartilhar o impacto de suas idéias nos GDS.  Esta proposta procura financiar a pesquisa necessária para fortalecer o componente KPI da Ferramenta do Proponente anteriormente financiada com sucesso, sem dúvida o elemento mais importante da ferramenta.  Juntamente com a pesquisa, eles estabelecem um roteiro de feedback alcançável para sintonizar estes KPIs com as propostas Catalyst.  Além disso, o resultado final deste trabalho inicial - um livro branco e apresentação - será útil para além do impacto da ferramenta em si, capacitando desenvolvedores e proponentes com formas de pensar sobre o alvo móvel que são os KPIs.  Finalmente, após experimentar a presente versão da Ferramenta do Proponente, posso ver o potencial para que ela seja uma boa ferramenta de brainstorming para proponentes com propostas específicas para SDG, ou mesmo apenas proponentes potenciais curiosos sobre como trazer SDG para suas propostas.
f6_assessments.q1: O AIM é um dos construtores de ferramentas mais estabelecidos no ecossistema Catalyst (estou usando sua ferramenta CA para criar esta avaliação) e tem uma reputação de desenvolver e entregar com confiabilidade.  Eles têm excelente acesso às comunidades, especialmente aos componentes específicos do SDG, portanto, a integração de suas funções de pesquisa e a coleta bem sucedida de feedback de propostas está dentro de suas capacidades.  O roteiro fornecido carece de granularidade durante as primeiras 6 semanas, mas destaca a avaliação de 5 sistemas KPI e a mecânica de relatórios para eles, o que proporciona pontos de auditoria naturais à medida que eles são verificados.  As 6 semanas seguintes são um pouco mais detalhadas e divididas entre a análise das propostas com os sistemas KPI avaliados, e finalmente a montagem do relatório final. O orçamento parece um pouco exíguo, e não cobre a entrega e apresentação do whitepaper, mas as horas estimadas para a pesquisa e análise parecem extremamente adequadas.
f6_assessments.q2: Embora mais detalhes sejam possíveis ao longo deste roteiro, ele tem múltiplos pontos de auditoria e 3 resultados (diretrizes, análise de propostas, livro branco) que serão fáceis de monitorar pela comunidade.  A equipe AIM é um membro da comunidade que contribui regularmente com um histórico de transparência e comunicação.  Com as 12 semanas desta proposta, pretende-se rolar para uma futura rodada de financiamento para o desenvolvimento da ferramenta, esta é uma proposta que se tornará responsável perante a comunidade e o feedback da comunidade.

f6_assessments.q0:
Impact:

This proposal is impressive on so many levels! Not only is it a shining example of a high quality proposal with a user-friendly, readable format, it has made my job as a CA easy to identify and assess Impact, Feasibility, Auditability. I have seen this tool used on several of the proposals I have assessed so far. Using it for myself, I have found it, like all AIM tools to be very user friendly, time saving & practical! This tool simplifies an overwhelming deep dive into the UN SDGs possibly never to resurface or be seen again.

*Impact on Cardano: As articulated under the title " SDGs and Catalyst/Cardano" this proposal not only impacts off chain issues & solutions, the Cardano blockchain, and the Project Catalyst community, it takes impact to a whole new level by showing "the actual impact of funded projects with clear KPIs" & continues "to position Cardano as the blockchain of sustainability, attract more collaborations with UN organizations and states as well as a growing number of companies and people concerned about impact and sustainability. It will show the community, and the world the impact of the funds provided." This proposal contributes in a real & meaningful way to fulfilling Cardano's mission of "Making the World Work Better for ALL." 

*Impact on Challenge Metrics & Goals: The F7: Improve and Grow Auditability challenge asks the question: How to make the auditing process of funded proposals efficient, distributed, and transparent? One of the possible directions is "Reporting on metrics, spending of financial resources." This proposal "will be able to measure the real ROI (return on intention) as well as demonstrate the actual impact of Catalyst on people's lives and nature.

The goal of this challenge is "Several projects evaluating funded proposals, providing reports, articles and metrics on the development and implementation of the projects.

This proposal adds another layer of auditability to this challenge. Well done to the team behind it for your forward thinking and making the path forward to tracking the impact of our contributions towards solving climate change. No government is on track to meet the 17 goals by 2030. They are too slow and inefficient to implement the necessary changes. You have provided a tool to help us get this done from the ground up, NOW. 

*Scale: From one fund to the next, I have seen firsthand how any tool initiated by AIM meets challenges head on. I have faith this team will be able to scale to address future challenges.

*Impact on the UN Sustainability Development Goals (SDGs): Is clear and easy to measure since they used their own tool for their proposal to assist in mapping their impact to the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals! The SDGs proposal tool https://cardanocataly.st/proposer-tool-sdg/ 

One of the challenges for future fund CAs may be confirming the accuracy of the self-selected goals.

Thank you to this team for taking the time and making the effort to create a clear & understandable proposal. 

(7) I most absolutely & strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge and goes two steps further by their efforts to impact climate change and make this impact measurable through Funded proposals in Project Catalyst and throughout Cardano as a whole.
f6_assessments.q1:
Feasibility 

* Team, including Skills & Experience: The two team members are experienced and well known through out the Catalyst Community. Yoram is a keystone member of Cardano4Climate. Without his continued support, guidance and bar raising, this thriving community would only be wishful thinking. In addition, for those who are familiar with the team members, the proposal provides evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. 

* Budget Amount, Breakdown, Timeline & Plan for Additional Funding: The modest budget is reasonable to achieve the set goals within the timeline & a plan for additional redundant. This proposal is the continuation of steps already taken in the right direction to impacting the environment with the creation of tools to measure and audit impact on the UN SDGs. 

* Resources both Off-Chain (Applications) & On-Chain (Technical): Raz presented their research on how many Fund 6 proposals. Turns out this was 97%, with 26% being aware of impacting the goals & another 70%, not knowing their proposals would have an impact on the 17 UN SDGs See https://youtu.be/SAPUIlLFYio?t=1286

 (5) is my overall rating for feasibility: It is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully. Not only have the proposers proven themselves in the past, they have the Cardano AIM, Project Catalyst, Sustainable ADA, WADA & Cardano4Climate communities behind them.
f6_assessments.q2:
Clarity/Auditability

My opinion of & support for this proposal is clear. 

* Roadmap: is simple, clear & will be easy to audit, with a clear goal "to perform the research and evaluation and to prepare a spec for the development of the KPI tool and reporting mechanism and offer it as a proposal for Fund 8.

* Metrics – KPIs: are simple, succinct & listed below the title, " SDGs - KPIs & measurements framework" 

* Problem Description: Why? " If we can show the actual impact of funded projects with clear KPIs, it will continue to position Cardano as the blockchain of sustainability and attract more collaborations with UN organizations and states as well as a growing number of companies and people concerned about impact and sustainability. It will show the community, and the world the impact of the funds provided." The challenge? " A key challenge to track project progress + effectiveness are clear impact measurements, especially for Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)" 

* Solution Description: What? " Researching the basis of an Impact Measurements Tool to help define KPIs, measure and report them, with a focus on SDGs impact." How? " The proposal seeks to research and design a framework that helps to integrate the KPIs already in the proposal process and measure them through the lifecycle of the project." 

(5) I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information within their "Working Plan" to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals. 

At the rate I write assessments, it is quite possible that I will run out of time before the 5pm UTC deadline to "rate" all the proposal I want/need to. I can let the pressure of this expectation go because, as a community advisor, a passionate supporter of the experiment called "Project Catalyst" and an active member of Cardano4Climate, I know beyond a shadow of a doubt that we are headed in the right direction(s). "Climate Change is a failure of cooperation"- Scott Poynton. Together, WE will not fail. 

In the meantime, my hope is that you, the voter, will read this proposal for yourself, connect to the problem & support the solution to this challenge with your voice and voting power.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aligns with the challenge partly. We have 100% match if we assume that Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are relevant for proposed projects. We have a lower match then we take into account, that 1/2 are directly and 2/3 indirectly related to SDGs impact. What I like a lot that we all are able to see an SDG-fit of the proposals in the future. What I can imagine is high potential using AI in order to run this analysis automatically. In this case it could scale and after the audibility even attract other investors/team members.
f6_assessments.q1: * The proposal includes an action plan with a realistic timeframe, measurable deliverables and presents a team that proves that it has the knowledge to execute the plan and provide value to Catalyst. What I like most are the increasing success metrics from 3 to 6 to 12 months. The budget breakdown is very short and could be more detailed, given the reasonable amount of money and the fair rate/hour I consider it as sufficient.
f6_assessments.q2: We get an understandable description of the targeted problem and an idea for the solution. The solution could be more specified.. But taking into account hat it is the beginning and research dependent, it is ok. The Catalyst community is able to audit it in a comprehensible manner.

f6_assessments.q0: This Proposal will be a valuable tool for proposers and community members that are thinking of proposing alike, is aligned with the challenge and will have a positive impact on the Catalyst ecosystem. The KPI's are also aligned with the challenge. Looking forward to see the next tool that will be able to define specific KPIs based on the project and sustainable development goals. The Last tool mentioned is the reporting tool to follow up on the KPIs progress. This could become a valuable tool to proposers.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has shown commitment to growing the Catalyst ecosystem through their other successful funded projects, I have confidence in them. The Budget is broken down and seems reasonable. The KPI's are set out and a timeline/road map with success measures is included in the proposal. All I am missing is the possible risks, and how they could be dealt with.
f6_assessments.q2: In their success measurements they set out what they would like to achieve by 3, 6 and 12 months, so the project is auditable. They should have added how it would be possible for the community and voters to follow the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: I want to say upfront that I have some significant expertise when it comes to the SDGs so I'm making a point to weigh in on this one. The SDGs are an important auditability metric of the already-existing UN system, and thus seeking avenues to integrate Cardano-based initiatives with the Global Goals already set by the international community isn't just effective but very important if we want Cardano to achieve widespread legitimacy as a productive and respectable financial system. Legitimacy really is the name of the game here: Eventually the Cardano community will be the world community, if we're successful, and so we need to operate in harmony with all the already-existing major evaluation mechanisms to grow and really have a social impact beyond the cryptocurrency subculture. So yes, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has already set up a tool for the same purpose and I even used one of their other tools just now (the CA tool) to find this proposal. This is definitely an achievable goal, with their talents. I'm certain they'll be successful if they get voter support.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is fair, and the funding request is more than fair. I'd look forward to seeing their KPI development plan myself. If anything, their goals might (emphasis *might*!) be a little bit on the modest side. I see no reason the SDGs couldn't be fully integrated into Cardano fund proposals, especially with regards to challenges focused on the developing world, as a priority, since it's a pre-existing evaluation mechanism we could take full advantage of sooner rather than later.

solution: Pesquisar a base de uma Ferramenta de Medidas de Impacto para ajudar a definir os KPIs, medi-los e relatá-los, com foco no impacto dos SDGs.
experience: Cardano AIM membros Catalyst ativos, Cardano4Climate, ADA sustentável, Fundo 6 financiado propostas SDG
